page.title: 05AGRICULTURE(int.pastoral)
page.content: This part of Salop has intensive past_ oral farming as its main land_use.It benefits from the reasonably high rain fall(this area gets 750_1000mm pa)good soil,gentle relief(making use of mach_ ines to sow,fertilise,or cut,easier)an above_average growing season,Jan temps over 5 degrees celcius,July temps bel_ ow 15"",and a mean of 3.5 hrs of sun daily(the latter factor necessary for fodder crops like barley,grown to pro_ vide for livestock in winter). The main pastoral land_use here is da_ irying;when not grazed,grass is cut as silage(May_Aug)or hay(June_Aug).Barley for winter fodder(cattle must be"hand_ fed"for 5 mths of the year)is sown Mar _April and harvested Aug_Sept. (Milk is collected by tanker and taken to a nearby centre to be processed and shipped to markets.
